intro: Callianthe brenesii, commonly known as the Guanacaste tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its large, compound leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces long, cylindrical fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in warm, humid climates. Callianthe brenesii plays an important ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
